situation: M struggled to transition from playtime to the literacy circle. She would become hyperactive and ignore verbal instructions from the teacher.
action: The teacher displayed a visual timer and a colorful cue card illustrating the next activity. This was used in conjunction with gentle reminders leading up to the transition. M was also allowed to bring a small fidget toy to the literacy circle to help focus her energy.
effect: Using the visual aids and gradual reminders, M became more adjusted. Bringing a fidget toy helped ease her anxiety and ground her into the new activity. With these strategies, M learned to adjust her behavior, improving her transition to the literacy circle significantly.
topic: Transition Difficulties - Moving between different activities or spaces
